sentences.en: Above all, the whiteness of the walls obsessed him.
sentences.cn: 首要的一点, 白晃晃的墙壁令他陶醉不已.

sentences.en: By the 1900 s , Bell was obsessed by the challenge of flight and speed.
sentences.cn: 到了1900年代, 贝尔醉心于飞行及速度的挑战.

sentences.en: Fear that someone might steal his money obsessed the old miser.
sentences.cn: 怕有人会偷钱的恐惧困扰着这个老吝啬鬼.
他沉溺于癖好中((嗜好使他分心)).

sentences.en: He wanted to banish this business from his mind, yet it obsessed him.
sentences.cn: 那点别扭劲儿又忽然回来了.不愿再思索, 可是心中堵得慌.

sentences.en: He was obsessed with gangster movies.
He was obsessed with the notion that he would find her in the crowd.
sentences.cn: 他脑子里成天成夜纠缠着一种幻想:他可能在人群中见到她.

sentences.en: He was petty-minded and obsessed with detail.
sentences.cn: 他小肚鸡肠，满脑子都是鸡毛蒜皮的事儿。

sentences.en: His opponents were still obsessed by his seeming invulnerability.
sentences.cn: 他的对手还仍然对他表面上的坚不可摧感到棘手.

sentences.en: I was obsessed by my physical imperfections.
sentences.cn: 我的身体缺陷令我很苦恼。

sentences.en: It is not every day that one meets a business-person who is not obsessed with Mammon.
sentences.cn: 不贪财的生意人可遇不可求。

sentences.en: My colleagues and I were obsessed with the detail of the stalled draft peace treaty.
sentences.cn: 我和同事们正在埋头研究卡了壳的和平协定草案的细节.

sentences.en: The idea that he might lose the position obsessed him.
sentences.cn: 可能会失去职务的想法使他心神不安.

sentences.en: The media seems obsessed with hyping up individuals or groups.
sentences.cn: 媒体似乎热衷于大肆吹捧某些个人或团体。

sentences.en: They become obsessed with trying to equip their vehicles with gadgets to deal with every possible contingency.
sentences.cn: 他们变得痴迷于给自己的车辆装备小配件，以应付可能出现的各种紧急情况。

trans.tran_cn: 着迷的，一门心思的，（思想）无法摆脱的
trans.tran_en: If someone is obsessed with a person or thing, they keep thinking about them and find it difficult to think about anything else

trans.tran_cn: 着迷( obsess的过去式和过去分词)，时刻困扰，缠住，使痴迷，使迷恋
